page.title: 10The Removal of the Cross
page.content: Over the years the cross has been in need of repair. In 1526 a certain lady left, in her will, 12d every year to repair the cross, this is the equivalent of 5p. In 1925 the cross was in need of repair and it was restored by order of His Majesty's Office of Works. The cross over the years has stood in many places, the last time it was moved was in 1966 and that was for road improvements by the Urban District Council. It was taken down stone by stone, each one being carefully numbered and stored. The shaft itself was wrapped and cased in wood for protection. In the soil beneath the cross several items of Roman origin were found. The cross was then reconstructed accurately in the centre of the new traffic island where it stands today.
